reviews.comments: Perfect location, walking distance to beach. Clean unit and easy check-in/check-out. Will likely be back again!

name: Apartment em Copacabana
summary: Apartamento de 3 cuartos em Copacabana, bem perto do Metro, ponto de onibus, e praia.  Casais ou mulheres preferidos. Se você está esperando para a festa dura, por favor, não entre em contato comigo. Este é um apartamento de família e absolutamente nenhuma das partes ou drogas!!!
description: Apartamento de 3 cuartos em Copacabana, bem perto do Metro, ponto de onibus, e praia.  Casais ou mulheres preferidos. Se você está esperando para a festa dura, por favor, não entre em contato comigo. Este é um apartamento de família e absolutamente nenhuma das partes ou drogas!!!

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

name: West Village townhouse private suite incl bath
summary: For one person only. Your own key leads to your own second-floor suite (bedroom plus bath) in 5 story house. A 15x15 foot private artfilled bedroom carpeted in Afghan rugs, 19th and 20th c antiques & 100s of books; small hallway w chair & mirror; all tile PRIVATE  bath w ceiling rainshower, garden view.  Room: twin bed w down duvet; chaise longue, chair, side tables, luggage & clothes racks, tea kettle, ceiling fan. No guests of guests or kitchen privileges.  Person booking must be guest.
space: Your room and bath are the entire 2nd floor of this beautifully restored and decorated 1850s brick townhouse in the West Village. The house has been published in several decor magazines, including photos of this bedroom.  The room is 15' by 15'.  There's a single bed with luxurious linens and European down comforter, an elegant 19th century chaise longue covered with silk, a working woodburning fireplace, hundreds of books, a 42 inch TV + VCR.. everything you need to unwind after a busy day in the city. Hotel-standard blackout curtains and white noise machine to ensure a good sleep, also a powerful but extremely quiet ceiling fan. All tile bath next door is small but has a rain shower head and window overlooking back gardens.  Shampoos, conditioners, bodywash, toothpaste and other toiletries are provided. There is a 3' by 3' antique mirror in the room itself. Also, the  bath has a large mirror at a somewhat inconvenient angle; there is another large mirror in the hallway between bathro
description: For one person only. Your own key leads to your own second-floor suite (bedroom plus bath) in 5 story house. A 15x15 foot private artfilled bedroom carpeted in Afghan rugs, 19th and 20th c antiques & 100s of books; small hallway w chair & mirror; all tile PRIVATE  bath w ceiling rainshower, garden view.  Room: twin bed w down duvet; chaise longue, chair, side tables, luggage & clothes racks, tea kettle, ceiling fan. No guests of guests or kitchen privileges.  Person booking must be guest. Your room and bath are the entire 2nd floor of this beautifully restored and decorated 1850s brick townhouse in the West Village. The house has been published in several decor magazines, including photos of this bedroom.  The room is 15' by 15'.  There's a single bed with luxurious linens and European down comforter, an elegant 19th century chaise longue covered with silk, a working woodburning fireplace, hundreds of books, a 42 inch TV + VCR.. everything you need to unwind after a busy day in the cit
neighborhood_overview: in the heart of the West Village (Greenwich Village)  - the best restaurants, bars, movie theaters and shopping in New York, in my opinion!  The immediate neighborhood has dozens of coffee shops, bars, and restaurants of every price level and description, as well as two art house cinemas (Film Form and IFC) and a Citibikes bike rental station. It is also near two major subway lines. Due to the stairs it is not suitable for infirm or disabled persons. There are two cats in the house but they won't enter your room (they can't open the door!).  The West Village is a vibrant, fashionable, affluent neighborhood of townhouses and small apartment buildings with some of Manhattan's best dining and shopping. It is near the Hudson River Park and contains several parks including Washington Square Park.
notes: There are two lovely cats in the house but they can't enter your suite unless you open the doors. You can have as much or as little interaction with them as you like. Choice of two pillows of your preferred type - soft, medium, firm
transit: five minute walk to either the ACDEF and M trains at Sixth Avenue and West Fourth Street or the 1 and 9 trains at Christopher and Seventh Avenue. Or pick up a Citibike on Sixth Avenue and Carmine!
access: NO GUESTS OF GUESTS for legal liability reasons! Guest has access to the suite, but not to the kitchen, laundry, garden or other rooms. There is an electric kettle, tea bags and tea cup in the room but no refrigerator or  cooking facilities. Guest has his or her own key to the house and can enter and leave 24 hours a day.  There are many coffee shops within a 3-4 minute walk, as well as bars and restaurants where you can get a drink or meal until late at night. There is a 24 hour grocer 2-3 minutes away on Bleecker Street.
interaction: Host works from home (online work) and is very quiet. Happy to answer questions but not looking for a social experience. The aim is for you to feel you are in your own private enclave.Best for a self-contained guest who values his or her privacy. No curfew, come and go as you like. But no visitors.
house_rules: Check in at noon and check out at 11 am, but you may leave your bags in the house until later in the day if necessary. Some flexibility for earlier check in; nothing before 9 am please. No hard-soled shoes above the ground floor please (to protect the antique flooring; sneakers are fine). No eating in the room please - otherwise insects will come! No pets and no guests please! Also, video rentals are not included, you must pay extra.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Writer and businesswoman, think tank fellow specializing in Afghanistan and Libya. Author of two memoirs. I love gardening and cooking and my house reflects that.

reviews.comments: Ann's place is absolutely gorgeous. The coziness mixed with the open architecture really makes it feel like a special place. Ann was really accommodating and nice, the area is super convenient and hip, and I had a great experience overall!
Ann's place is in a great location. Close to everything. West village is a great place for foods, bars and other things. Ann is pretty nice and the place is very clean and comfortable.
Great location in NYC and a kind and gracious host.

I had a great stay with Ann in the private room and bath in townhouse. I was in NYC for an all day workshop and needed a place to sleep and shower and the accommodation was perfect for one person. The location was in walking distance of my workshop and a lot of great restaurants. Ann was also very helpful with answering my questions prior to arriving and showing me around the house. I will definitely consider booking another reservation in Ann the next time I am in the Soho area.

Though I had a crazy schedule and too little time to enjoy the village and Ann's hospitality I couldn't have been more pleased by the gracious and welcoming experience and the remarkable setting. I highly recommend a stay here for matchless access to the heart of this vibrant manhattan neighborhood.
Ann was a gracious host and her townhouse is in a great location with many restaurants within walking distance.

I enjoyed my stay at Ann's house. I came to New York for business and I wanted to feel like home; I didn't want to stay once again in a big anonymous hotel chain. I turned to AirBnB on Greenwich Village and immediately liked Ann's house pictures. She responded within minutes. Her house is full of souvenirs from trips around the world, tapestry, books, antiques, pictures, etc. It felt cozy, and in my mind I was transported to a different world. I had my own bathroom and room. The house is located at the heart of Greenwich Village, walking distance to bakery, cafés, restaurants, shops, etc.
Ann was a gracious host. Her house is simply stunning. The location couldn't be better. Amazing architechture with a stylish and tasteful interior, topped off by the coolest pull-up bar I ever used.
Great place, very well located. Ann was very friendly and responsive.

Ann has been a great host. We strongly recommend her and her lovely space in the heart of the most trendy neighborhood of NYC!
Romain
Was in town for a conference. Great place and very nice host. Excellent location.

When I stayed at this West Village townhouse, my host was there. I would say everything is as described, however I must warn future guests about the cats. Although they are not allowed in the guest room, the townhouse smells of cat spray. Granted this is something that you may become accustomed to after a day or two, but in my opinion, it is quite strong. I did not talk to my host about this while I was there, as I didn't feel as if I had any other options for moving. I kept the windows open, and used the fan... And by day two I only noticed it when I first came in.
Cool neighbourhood, lovely house.

I delayed in booking a place to stay for a recent work trip. Luckily, Ann responded and confirmed within an hour of my inquiry and I was able to check in later that day.

Ann was there to let me in and gave me a tour of her home. As Ann lives here and works from home, this isn't a place to hang out in. For the right person, this means that you have a glimpse into a gorgeous and eclectic NYC brownstone and a lovely bedroom and bathroom to retire to at the end of the day. As Ann has mentioned herself, this set-up is more suitable for solo travelers and/or people on business. In any case, it was perfect for my work trip and I loved the rugs and textiles from around the world that made up the interior design of the room. 

The location is unbeatable, right around the corner from cafe's and restaurants, and a few blocks from the W 4th subway stop from where you can get anywhere.

There are AirBnB places you stay in to save money on a hotel, and then there are AirBnB places so special that they'd be worth the visit regardless. This falls into the latter category. Perfectly-located in the West Village, this beautiful house from the 1800s is impeccably renovated and beautifully decorated. The room, up a narrow winding wooden staircase (so beautiful and unique!) is extremely comfortable and quiet by NYC standards, and the bathroom is well set-up, if cozy. I was there on a cool August week and the ceiling fan was all I needed. I would highly recommend this spot for anyone traveling to NYC.
I really enjoyed my stay. Communication with the host was fast and efficient. The location is perfect, and the house is very beautiful and unique. The room was spacious and comfortable.
Very comfortable place to stay. Brief meet up with Ann but very informative as to all the details of the place. The room was well stocked with fascinating books.

Ann was a very good host, and the place was very well maintained.  Great neighborhood, private bathroom definitely a plus.  I'll definitely stay there again if I get a chance.  I love cats but I'm slightly allergic to them, but they weren't an issue at all.  No cat smells, etc that others left comments about.  I was a little late leaving in the morning, so there was a 5 minute cross fade as the other guest arrived, which she was very understanding about!  My first airbnb experience, and it was great.
Thank you very much for hosting me. I very much enjoyed your beautiful home and being so close to my travel points.
Ann was a perfect host and her house was warm, welcoming and friendly. It's in a perfect location and great if you want to have a real New York experience. Thanks Ann!

Had a lovely time at Ann's beautiful townhouse,stayed five nights for work. Best location in the city. Great shower - nice private bath,and Alice spaciuos room.

Sleep quality was so so. There are two bars just outside,so it gets quite loud at night,so didn't sleep much the first  and second night. But loved my stay and would stay again for sure.

Ann was a great host. Friendly but unintrusive. The house is visually pleasing and comfortable. Tons of great books and nice pieces of furniture with a great sense of style. The location is wonderful. Tons of great restaurants and clubs/bars as well as shops. The cats are nice guys as well.

A very nice and charming apartment and bedroom, excellent location, the room and bathroom were very clean. The host is reliable and very respectful, clear and straightforward in her explanations which I appreciated.  Some noise in the street in the evening but not enough to be troublesome. I would recommend it without any hesitation.

I stayed at Ann's beautiful townhouse for five nights and I mostly enjoyed it. There are a lot of pros, but also two cons. 

Ann is very friendly and helpful. She was always there when I had questions. 
The location is simply great. It's only a two minutes walk to the next subway station (W 4 St). The neighborhood is charming and safe, there are tons of cafés, restaurants and shops nearby. I especially liked Amy's Bread (Leroy/Bleecker) for Breakfast and Coffee, the Risotteria (Bleecker) and the fantastic Falafel at Taim (222 Waverly Place) for dinner. 
My room on the first floor was big enough and clean. The bed was comfy and there was also a small couch to sit and relax. With regard to the location it is really tough to find a Hotel room for this rate with similar amenities. 

But there were also two little downsides. As a guest had mentioned before there was a light smell on the ground floor. It might be from the two cats, although there are exceptionally clean and very cute by the way. But since I slightly noticed the smell in my room and had to work there for a while, I bought a small air refresher. After that it was fine. 
Second, the noise level. For New York, the room is mostly quite, since Leroy Street has almost no through travel and there is no Bus station nearby. But there is a bar vis-à-vis and another one nearly beside the house. On Friday and Saturday both seem to be opened until 4 am. Although I used ear plugs, I woke up a few times during these nights until 4. On the other nights it was absolutely no problem and the noise level from the bars was low. 

On the whole I would return – but maybe not on a Friday and Saturday.

Ann was really busy but she gave me all the info I need she looks fantastic, the place was nice and private, clean and confortable. many city guides in different languages were available for free,
hope to come back

I very much appreciated the beautiful room and the location at Ann's NY apartment.  The bed was very comfortable and to be surrounded by interesting books and art was wonderful.  Super restaurants close by and Washington Square not far. The ensuite, compact but functional and very clean.  Ann was very helpful. A great stay!

Ann's lovely house was the perfect base for a whirlwind work trip to New York. It's a very large bedroom for Manhattan -- though (as others have noted) it could have done with a proper mirror --  and I really liked the decor. Everything was clean and elegantly presented and NB I didn't  find the bar opposite a problem. The location is AMAZING. I am a keen runner and ended up going for long runs down the Hudson shore (just at the bottom of Leroy Street) almost every day because it was so perfect. Great places to eat and shop abound (Snack is a great Greek place over the road, Spunto did wonderful pizzas, Bread was great for breakfast but there were hundreds more places I never got the chance to try). I'd thoroughly recommend staying here.

Ann was a gracious host and was very patient with my Rrival and departure despite some last minute delays on my part. Apartment was as described and if anything more beautiful and better location than description conveys. Enjoyed my stay and would recommend.

I strongly regret staying here. The host was rude and aggressive. I did not feel welcome and the stay was extremely uncomfortable. The TV was broken and she actually told me to fix it. She then said I should have my relatives fix it (my relatives live in NY). Also, read the entire listing - your movement in the house is highly restricted. I assume the host will leave a rude and aggressive response like she has done to other guests. Know this before you stay here.

It was simply fantastic to stay with Ann. From the minute I arrived to the time I had to depart, it was great to get to know her, talk about friends we have in common, and share a bit of my life and art with her.  She reciprocated generously, and I will definitely stay with her again. My suite was perfectly stunning: worldly, calm, and full of unique books and art.   I cannot think of a better place to have landed for my birthday weekend.  Thanks, Ann!!
As always a wonderful place to stay while visiting New York. Restful and unique!

It was great to stay in Ann's home again.  My last visit was spectacularly rich, and this one followed suit.  Ann greeted me warmly and  we shared art-world updates, which is perhaps one of my favorite things to do in the world.  She showed me up to the suite and pointed out the gorgeous new bedding, which I appreciated both aesthetically and practically.  Throughout my stay she was welcoming and warm and also gave me plenty of space to digest my full days.  All in all, a much appreciated home base!!  Thank you, Ann!

Ann is a very friendly host, very discrete and quiet. The room is beautiful and decorated in a unique way, as is the house.  I only got to see the living room area in the rest of the house but it was fabulous. You get your own private shower room and toilet, on your own floor, which is great in terms of privacy and independence. This is an opportunity to stay in an authentic West Village Townhouse, superbly decorated and very convenient for metro (W4St less than a 10 min walk) and all kinds of shops and restaurants literally at your doorstep.

I absolutely loved staying with Ann. Her townhouse is warm, charming, eclectic, homey - a perfect retreat in the middle of the city. 
The room was decorated with artifacts from what has to be a lifetime of travel and research. I felt smarter just sleeping there. 
Having a couple of very affectionate cats check in on me from time to time was an added bonus. 
Will definitely try to visit again soon.

Ann, 
Thank you so much for being such a lovely host. 
I very much enjoyed staying in your home for my stay in West Village. You have a wonderful oasis in such a fantastic spot. I will certainly come and stay again if our calendars align.
Best,
Sarah

Booked just 2 days in advance, Ann was very accommodating.  Her charming room and the small but functional bathroom offer everything one needs for a short stay in NYC's best neighborhood.   Ann's historic home is extraordinary - a very special, eclectic space that the pictures don't quite do justice.   As a host, Ann is well-organized, very flexible, easy-going, and quiet/reserved but friendly.   I thoroughly enjoyed being surrounded by Ann's global collection of objets d'art as well as her purring felines.

Great and friendly host.  Ann is a very accommodating person.
The location is as good as it gets, in a safe and vibrant section of the West Village.
The room is cozy and charming.
Ann will make sure you will never want for fresh towels :)
I recommend this listing highly.

Awesome place to stay in the city.  Ann was a great host and has a lovely and charming house in the best part of Manhattan.  The room was very pleasant and full of character.   I would definitely come back :)
Ann was great! Was flexible meeting me when my bus was late. The room was as advertised and had everything I needed. Would definitely return.

Ann was a great host - available and welcoming when I arrived. Good communication prior to arrival. Superb location, walking distance to restaurants, bars, clubs, and subway. House was amazing, modern and spacious. Room was cozy in a good way, very clean. Private bathroom. Would definitely stay again.
Ann was a welcoming host; and very timely in her response as well. The room was lovely, and one cannot beat the location. I'd highly recommend this rental.
Beautiful, eclectic residence. Bedroom suited me fine except for noisy street at night.

Ann's home is in a fantastic neighborhood with countless restaurants and bars just steps away. The home was beautifully decorated with lots of light and two friendly cats. The spacious rooms and private (and very clean!) bathroom is a big plus. Ann was a great host who is clear, concise and friendly, I had a lovely stay!
The host canceled this reservation 24 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The home is as advertised in a great location
Very convenient accommodations - close to everything! Ann is very helpful and quick to respond. Thanks for a great stay :)

Stayed here on a business trip during NY fashion week. Hotels were $600 per night plus. I stayed at her very central W village town house for a LOT less than that. It's exactly as described  -  a bedroom and small bathroom on its own floor. Great for one person. Very centrally located wit good wifi and Ann was great and very amenable. Got me the key when I arrived  (an hour earlier than I expected) and worked with me to easily get the key back upon departure. Left me fresh towels and even some teabags for my morning cuppa.

This woman is neurotic and irritated about everything. Not suited to having Airbnb guests in her home. Constantly screening out restrictive house rules. Telling me she is stressed and doesn't get much $ for letting me rent.   

 While her place is an excellent location and the room is nice, Ann is a basket case.   Try other locations first

Ann was very welcoming and her place is delightful, with antique floors and a wooden spiral staircase that must be over 100 years old!  You also can't go wrong with such a great location in the W Village of NYC.  I know the city well, so I was happy to come and go as I pleased, and Ann made it very easy for me to do that.  It was great to have my own bedroom and bathroom space, but I also appreciated that she was there if I had needed her for anything (not that I did, but you just never know!)  She's a very interesting person and she struck just the right note in being there as a host, but also letting me do my own thing.  

he bedroom is quite large for a NYC place, but still, it's NYC and the W Village, so anyone travelling from out of town needs to keep in mind.  It's plenty of room for 1 person, and maybe even 2 people as long as you realize it's a NYC brownstone.

I would recommend Ann's place to anyone who wants to have a unique place to stay in the city. I really hope that I can stay here again the next time I come to NY!

Ann ist eine freundliche Gastgeberin, die sehr gut kommuniziert und einem alles erklärt was man zur Unterkunft wissen muss. Sie hat ein paar Regeln, an die sich der Gast halten soll, und das ist auch in Ordnung. Das Zimmer war exakt wie in der Beschreibung. Die Einrichtung ist sehr gemütlich und bequem. Es fehlt Platz um Klamotten zu deponieren. Die Lage ist fantastisch! Die Strasse ist nachts ruhig, aber bis 11:00 Uhr macht der Pub gegenüber Krach, weil alle Raucher draußen stehen. Das Bad ist aber definitiv zu klein. Die Dusche ist gleich das Bad, beim Duschen wird alles nass. Ich denke ich würde nächstes Mal lieber eins teilen wenn es dafür größer ist und eine richtige Dusche hat.

Anne was a lovely host and was very thoughtful regarding my comfort.  The apartment is in a great location, it's clean, quiet and peaceful and the bed is very very comfortable.  Although the room is within the apartment, it's very private as you have a level to yourself.  Highly recommended. Thanks Anne!

Ann was welcoming and accommodating. Her townhouse is a gem and although the photos are great, in reality it's better. The guest room is unique, warm, and beautiful; you're in your own world there.
Thanks, Ann!

I had a great stay at Ann's.  Checking in and out was easy, and I appreciated the house details being printed out.  The room is super comfortable, clean, and as described and has a great heater as it's starting to get chilly in NYC!  And the bathroom is a bit odd, as has been mentioned before, but it's such a score to have your own bathroom and it looks out at the back garden which is really cool.  The location is awesome, near cafes & subway and easy walking to so many other great neighborhoods.  It is across from a bar, but I never needed the white noise machine, I slept really soundly.  And in total there is only 1 flight of stairs... no crazy walkups.  I highly recommend!
The bars next door produce loud noises into the wee hours of the night.  Otherwise, the location is perfect for exploring the Village and Soho.
Lovely room in a great location

This was a terrific place to stay, and I was made to feel very welcome and looked after. The room is beautiful and the en suite great. The entire space is very fascinating with artwork and books galore.  The location is second to none really, just of Bleecker.

Ann was flexible and welcomed me warmly into her beautiful home.   The house is beautiful but you really only get access to the middle floor (not the kitchen or backyard it seems).  That being said it was a perfect stay and it is located in one of the most convenient beautiful areas of the city.
I had such a wonderful time staying with Ann in her beautiful house. Especially spending time with the cats!

I had a very enjoyable stay at Ann's.  The room was clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom was just outside the bedroom door which was very convenient.  The neighborhood was nice and I found it relatively quiet. It served my needs perfectly.

Ann had everything ready when I arrived. 
I had total flexibility to come and go
The room is great with amazing furniture and quite private from the rest of the house.
The location is unbeatable.
Good neighborhood, nice place, average host.

Ann was very accommodating and responsive despite my schedule necessitating a late evening checkin. 

the accommodation itself is  great; very comfortable and great location.
A beautiful room, in a great location. The listing was very accurate in every detail. The cats were friendly, but not intrusive. The bath small, but functional. Would love to stay here again.

Ann was great, very chill, and has the vibe like she's lived in Greenwich Village for decades. The place is just as described, and on a relatively quiet street right near lots of happening spots. If you want the authentic Greenwich Village experience, I would recommend.

The bed might be a little tight for two, but that's my only niggle -- everything else was super smooth.

In short:  Such a great place. If you are interested in the West Village OR Hoboken, NJ, stay here. In particular:

- The location is second to none. I'm sure there are tons of great locations in the West Village, but I don't any are better than this. Ann's place is on a side street that is relatively quiet, but still very lively. The windows of the guest room look out over the street, so it feels like you're really in the Village. 

- Ann is super nice, communicative, and knowledgable about the area. She was always available for questions.

- The place is beautiful, the shower is fantastic (the entire bathroom is the shower; sounds odd but works great and is really sort of cool), the guest room feels very private. You truly have your own space while staying here.

Mine was last minute booking. Ann was accommodating & Welcoming. She made sure that was present when I arrived & attended to my requests. 


Her home is historic & cultural ring to it. She as vast bookshelf in the room which is rare these days. the bed is comfortable. the green couch is nice & relaxing. she has installed a white noise machine in the room which super useful to tune-out outside noises. Its location is great. everything is nearby. 

I had a good stay except the checkout process. My flight was in afternoon but I was asked to leave exactly at 11AM which I can understand as that's the checkout time. Hence, I complied. However, even when I checked out was the room & was waiting for my uber in the common area. she kept asking when would I leave. I felt unwanted. So I took my luggage & preferred to stand on street while waiting for my uber to take my to airport instead being inside of the house where I felt unwanted.

So you are planning to stay here, I would advice you to discuss the checkout process upfront.

I was in NYC for a concert.  Ann's was great making sure I had everything I needed, she even lent me an umbrella when the weather took a turn for the worst.  It was easy to get in and out of the house and the location is perfect.
Ann's place is in an ideal location.  It is perfect launching pad into the city!

Ann has a beautiful home, and it was everything I needed for my short stay in New York City. From the location, to the amenities, to the room itself - everything was how Ann described and more! I have visited New York City countless times in the past, but her home truly made me feel like I was a new visitor to the city. I felt fully immersed in the culture of the city. Great home, and I fully recommend staying here!

Excellent location, excellent host, beautiful room!!
Recommended!
Host was friendly, punctual, and had a very interesting book collection in the guest room.

I had to change accomodation suddenly and booked this apartment at midnight on the day I was arriving. Ann got back to me straight away to confirm even though she was sleeping! She was a wonderful host, very helpful and always welcoming. The area is one of my favourites and the apartment is just steps away from Bleeker Street (cafes, shops, whatever you need), very close to transport and the lovely Hudson River. The apartment is stunning, in a gorgeous street which was quiet and safe. There is a bar across the street but it was not busy or noisy at all, if there was noise there is a machine provided in the room with sounds like white noise or rain which you can use to help you sleep. Thanks for a great last minute stay!

Ann kept in touch with me before and during my stay to arrange to let me in , showed me where things are and how they worked and even offered to let me leave my luggage there after check if I wanted.  The place is in a great location in the Village right in the middle of things. I was attending a technical class at AbleCine video rental house which was about 10 minutes walk. Daddy-O's pub is just around the corner and their kitchen stays open late, just past the pub is The Grey Dog which has a great breakfast selection.  It was nice to just walking around the area which is designated as historic on one plaque I saw.

Ann was an incredible host with a beautiful home...within 5 mins' walk of everywhere I wanted to go in Greenwich Village, and only half an hour's walk from Penn Station. Her home is so beautiful and interesting, and I was very comfortable.

Ann is an excellent host, very accommodating and communicative.  I felt instantly at home in her home and the whole experience was very easy and comfortable.  Everything is very much as per the description, so no surprises and the neighborhood, the West Village of NYC is really great.  Extremely calm, safe and fun.  Lots of great restaurants and things to do.  All in all, an excellent quick trip and having Ann's place as a home-base was great!
The location was great, close to gorgeous jazz clubs and brunch places at West Village. The room was very private.
Great location, welcoming host!
Great location in Soho. The space is charming and neat. There is  plenty of privacy.  Good for one person.

This accommodation was exactly as described, ann was there to greet me, and I felt comfortable the moment I entered the home and my room.  There are amazing artifacts and art work everywhere each day I discovered something new.  In addition a treasure trove of books.  The neighborhood is one of my favorites in the city and I know I will return.  Subway is close by, buses are available, and you don't have to walk far in the morning to get a great cappuccino.

I was running a bit late for my original check-in time and Ann could not have been more gracious about it, which set the tone for the entire stay. I was in town for a conference and was barely in the beautiful suite, but I felt so comfortable being able to come and go. The room is just as beautiful as the pictures show and the artwork is just fabulous. The private bathroom was extremely convenient and I loved the waterfall shower-head. Ann's cats were also so sweet and well-behaved. If I attend the same conference next year, I would absolutely love to spend my nights in this suite again! Absolutely recommend!
Loved staying here.  Wonderful location! Very easy to communicate with Ann.  Interesting home, definitely worth the value. Sweet cats.

Ann was a very good host. She was clear about expectations and that helps a lot. Her place is in an awesome location, grest neighbourhood and comvenient if you commute mostly by subway. Great decor in the house and the room. Recommended.
Great location. Comfy bed. Ann was very accommodating
Great location, charming place, friendly and helpful hostess - highly recommended (I reckon I'll be back!)
Great interaction. Ann went out of her way to welcome me into her home. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a place to stay in the Village.

Yes, I felt very welcome.  Ann knew I wanted to check in a bit earlier than 1pm, and she called me once the room and bathroom were ready.  I wanted to stay in the West Village, so I knew what the area was like. My stay included Friday and Saturday, so there was some noise, but I used earplugs, and it was no problem. The room was beautiful, and I loved having a private bathroom. I would definitely stay there again if our schedules worked out.
Loved this place. Brilliant location. Beautiful house

This was the perfect rental for me. When I am in NYC, I am not 'home' much, and just want privacy, a quiet place, and a great neighborhood. This fit all those bills! Ann is low-key, very responsive, and her home is funky and cool and in the best neighborhood on Manhattan.
The neighborhood is perfect! Right where you'd want to be! The room is a nice size and very comfortable!
Ann was great and very accommodating!
Ann was friendly and accommodating and had a lovely home in a great neighborhood.

The room is very beautiful, romantic, cozy and private. The inner design is fantastic and inspiring with vintage, modern and other diverse elements corresponding with each other in harmony. There is a big mirror outside the room between the bathroom and stairs and people look nice in it. Cats are so cute and sweet. Coming back after a tiring day, they may sit by the door to welcome you! Around the corner are a bar, many restaurants and boutiques, it feels good to walk around and explore the old street. The host is very nice and accommodating. My check-in delayed for about 2 hours because of the traffic and the heavy rain, but Ann waited for me until I finally came. Thank you for that! I really had a tight schedule for these 2 days, but I hope I can come back in the future and further explore the house and the surroundings. Thank you!

Ann was great!  She was extremely flexible in letting me drop my bags when my flight arrived early.  The room was great, and the bed was comfortable.  Loved the neighborhood!  No complaints from me about this fantastic trip! Thanks again, Ann!
Great location and good value.
Ann has a gorgeous home in a prime location. The suite is cozy,  artfully decorated and inviting. Will definitely stay here again!

Anne's offered room is a part of a beautiful home near a short walk to excellent food and entertainment. The surrounding neighborhood is nice but like most NYC neighborhoods there can noise all night of varying degrees. Anne provides a white noise machine and the means to regulate the temperature of the room, separate from the rest of the house.

Anne can also give great recommendations to surrounding cuisine and will happily walk you through all maintenance and upkeep expected during your stay.
Ann was very communicative and helpful. The location is great, right around the corner there were so many fun restaurants. Definitely recommend staying here!
Everything was great. No complaints
I loved everything about my stay - Thank you for making me feel so at home!

Ann's place is absolutely incredible. The property is stunning, clean and unique. Location is marvelous and Ann is a wonderful host. Recommend without any hesitations. Property probably not suitable for children, given the fine furnishings, art and beautiful rugs.
Ann was a very gracious hostess. She made me feel very welcome and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.
My stay at Ann's place was fantastic! Very accommodating. Beautiful place!

This is the most beautiful home I've ever stayed in! I loved every detail. I wish I could have stayed more than one night. Ann is very kind and accommodating (and I suspect very cool given the various art pieces in her home). The views are gorgeous (so many windows), and the location is also the best that I've ever been lucky enough to be in for a stay in NYC. Right around the corner from famous places like Cafe Wha? and the Comedy Cellar, and in a five minute walk you can get pretty much anything on the planet. And in the bedroom there's a little station for water and hot tea, a bunch of cool lamps of different varieties, a space heater, a white noise machine, and a million books!
Ann was a great host.  Easy communication and very responsive.  The place is at a great location, and it's clean and comfortable.

Everything is very accurately represented in words and pictures in the posting. The art and antiques are really beautiful and create a very special space. The location in the West Village is perfect. It was a very cold windy night when I stayed there and the room needed the space heater that Ann thoughtfully provides. The only downside was that the apartment is across from a tavern and there were folks out on the street being loud till late (it was a Saturday night). Ann provides a sound machine, which was much needed (and helped a lot). The room and bath were as advertised and very well appointed (ie, toiletries in the bath, towels, etc). Lovely space.
Ann is a great host and has a beautiful home. It is in a great location in the village and very close to nightlife, restaurants, and the subway. The neighborhood is very safe and well lit.
Great location. The room itself is spacious. A bit noisy being near bars but the white noise machine helps significantly. Reasonable value.

Cute bohemian room in a busy part of Grenich Village. Ann was a great host and provided a perfect arrival experience with excellent communication.  I would definitely stay here again given the great location and low nightly pricing. It was a very easy bnb experience.

Ann's place is charming and comfortable and is located in the perfect spot for exploring the neighborhood and further afield. Situated near the subway, beautiful tree-lined avenues and a wide range of restaurants and cafes.

The room was tastefully decorated and comfortable with access to the shower/toilet on the same floor. The bed was comfy. I would have welcomed some tea making facilities, however, after traveling on the city subway from JFK (which is actually quite doable and takes around an hour).

The environment is gorgeous and I can thoroughly recommend a stay here. I will certainly return and could easily spend a week here exploring city life!

I can't imagine a better place to stay to experience the West Village. Ann was a fabulous hostess --- friendly and welcoming, but also very considerate of her guests space and privacy. Her place is a dream....artfully decorated, cozy and peaceful and yet right in the heart of the village. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Ann provides a charming flat in an ideal location, clearly communicated house rules, and an accurate description of the space. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and I really appreciated the private bathroom. The sound recordings of nature are very helpful for sleeping at night. Ann's place was ideal for this solo traveler.

Thanks Ann!
I loved staying in Ann's place, although it was a little noisy outside because of the bar downstairs!

Ideal location -- more delicious, varied, affordable food within walking distance than you'll have time to enjoy!  Very comfortable place for one person. Some street noise on weekends, but white-noise machine helps on Saturday nights. All other times, apartment wonderful quiet getaway.  Clean spacious room, pleasant helpful host. This is my new favorite place to stay in NY.

Ann place is wonderful, the location and the room are perfect for the village in NYC. Close to restaurants    
Cinema, or music. I was able to rest at Ann 's place peacefully.
It's a great location.
Ann is a great host, she has a beautiful home in a central location. She was always checking in to see if I needed anything and was flexible when I needed to extend my stay.

Ann's place is in an outstanding location: immediately next to food and drink, just down Houston St, a quick walk from the subway to get up town. It's a fun, funky, old room and basically just as advertised. I had one hot night with no AC, which isn't her fault, but I didn't think to ask in advance.

Ann's home is such a delight to visit-  it is always such a treat to stay over! Thank you so much, Ann, for a wonderful night's sleep within a stone's throw of so many fun things to do. Even walked to Broadway. Xx

The place is everything is advertised, in a superb location! Everything is really close and safe. 

Ann is an excellent host and she always willing to help and accomodate you in the best way possible. 

Great place to stay if you're on Business and need a connected location.
Place was just as the description states.

Great location, great value, and great host. Very thoughtful, well set up room. My only issue was the proximity to the street. No air conditioning means window open at night, and people smoking and yelling outside was less than ideal. But hey it's New York and the price is great so well worth the trade off.

Ann's room is spacious, clean and beautifully decorated - and was a perfect little retreat at the end of the day from the madness that is NY! It is also located in my favourite part of the city, with many great little cafes, restaurants and bars within very short walking distance. Ann is a very considerate host - I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

Ann has a great place in an even better location. I had to check-in very last minute and Ann was just a phone call away. Her place was located in the heart of the West Village, and was close to everything I could have hoped for. She had a very clean place and was more than accommodating.  I will definitely be staying here again when I need a place to stay in the city.
Ann is a great host! The location is prime West Village and very unique.
Exotic home, fabulous location in Greenwich Village, gracious host - will return. A great New York experience.

La habitación es tal cual aparece en las fotos, tenés un baño privado y privacidad. No sentí en absoluto ruidos de la calle. La habitación estaba impecable igual que el baño. La ubicación es perfecta aunque cualquier lugar de Nyc lo es porque el subte funciona perfecto. Recomiendo el lugar para pasar unos días -si uno quiere estar más tiempo por supuesto iría a un departamento entero-.
Ann's place is well-situated, clean and comfortable, and Ann is a thoughtful host.

A lovely home in which to experience an authentic Manhattan experience. An attentive host, respectful of one's privacy. Excellent communication throughout. 
Charming and spacious room, private bathroom with an excellent shower. 
Lovely area, well-situated for metro stations, walking distance to many interesting places such as the Highline (close to downtown end) and the Hudson River west bank, which is a great walk, all the way to the World Trade Center complex.
It was a lovely experience returning 'home' each day, all topped off by two of the friendliest cats in the world.
Highly recommended, with thanks again to Ann for a pleasant visit.
Great location! Close proximity to lots of nightlife and restaurants.
Ann's is a wonderful place and in a great location for exploring the village.

Ann's home is in the heart of Greenwich Village - a hotbed of amazing restaurants, nightlife, and culture. Walkable to high-traffic subway lines that can get you anywhere in the city. Great location, welcoming host! So nice to have a private bathroom. Thank, Ann!
Ann is a wonderful host: kind, precise and reliable. Her place is great: the location is unique, in the very heart of NY, and the house is very nice! Thank you, Ann!!
Great location
Great location for what I wanted to do - see Jazz in the West Village and go to some museums! Lots of food options and easy access to the subway as well.
Amazing location, room and host! Truly, it was a great experience all around, highly recommended!

Ann has a wonderful place and is a magnificent host.  The room is private and cozy with it's own bathroom, plenty of windows, and a nice chaise lounge chair for relaxing or reading.  Ann also took the time to tend to and explain every detail from towels to wifi info to linens.  The entire home abounds with charm and character....I only wish I was staying a bit longer.

Ann's place was great! It was perfectly located to everything I needed while in town for a conference. I grew up in a city, I live in a city, and I'm used to city noise, but this was even louder than I expected; luckily, Ann keeps a white noise machine in the room, which worked wonderfully.

Excellent location for exploring the West Village and surrounding neighborhoods, visiting NYU.  Perfectly clean private bath -- and I am very particular! -- with nice strong rain shower.  Friendly kitty household -- I enjoyed meeting and petting them, though folks who don't love cats might not love that.  Bars/restaurants downstairs and across the street were noisy rather late, but it was a Friday night, so not surprising.  I hadn't realized there wasn't air conditioning (I'm sure I just missed it), but I was comfortable with the window closed and just the ceiling fan after a warm September day.  Ann is friendly, helpful, and otherwise hands-off, which suited me fine!  Thank you!

Make sure to bring your own water bottle! Even though this is an Air bed and breakfast, the host won't be kind enough to provide you with water or even to fill up your water bottle. She does the very minimum and isn't too friendly. Also there is no air conditioning so the room is disgustingly hot. Location is prime though!

Convenient location. Met basic needs. Works for professional looking for place to rest/sleep. If you're looking for more of a hotel experience this is not the place for you. Host respects privacy and responsive to communication.
This place is at a great location. Good restaurants, jazz venue, coffee shop were near by. The house is exactly what Ann described and enjoyed my short stay at the place.

Great location - pretty much central to all the main attractions. Street noise was a non issue and I’m a pretty light sleeper. ( the white noise machine certainly helps). Room had everything a typical hotel would have. Her cats are the sweetest too! Would definitely stay here again.

Ann's place let me feel like I was living in New York.  The room is very comfortable and large, photo's were accurate.   Ann was easy to communicate with and was there for me at the time I wanted to check in.

Ann's room is amazing
Smooth communication and check in 
Comfortable room and bathroom
She is a great guest
Great location, lovely neighborhood. Many local eateries.
Ann's place is at an amazing location, with lot's of opportunities nearby. The room itself was great and Ann was very helpful and considerate. If I am in the area again, I will book again.

As others have written, Ann provides a detailed description of her accommodations, and it is accurate. The location is very convenient to a number of subway lines and provides very easy access to lower Manhattan. I was there on a weeknight, and it was quiet. Many restaurants are nearby along with so much more. My stay was short, and I traveled with only a backpack. If I’d had a suitcase, I might have had trouble on the curved stairs to the second floor—but I am 70 and not as sure footed as I used to be.
Ann’s place has great location and it’s very quiet. Very nice decorated furnitures in the room and we had great time there.

Ann is very kind person and her apartment is a classic, authentic West Village townhouse experience. The accommodation is really like your own private floor and the decor is bohemian chic.  The bed is comfortable, and the room is very private. Her cats are very sweet as well. It's a very cool place in 
an excellent location. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay at Ann's place again!
Cool place to stay close to cool places to eat and hangout.
The host canceled this reservation 16 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Ann is a great host and very responsive.  Room was awesome and great village location

This is the perfect accommodation for a solo traveler in NYC. The room is beautiful (and also the cats). Ann was very responsive- especially when I was having trouble with the door one night. It was a good stay.
Great location, beautiful house, and smooth communications with Ann.

A gem. A spacious upstairs room, comfy bed, full of fantastic decor and charm! RIght in the heart of the Village. The most authentically Village experience I've found on Airbnb.  And Ann is marvelous; I felt right at home. Highly recommend.
Very cool and unique space in the heart of the West Village. Remarkably convenient location.  Adorable cats.  Cool art.

NIce place in a great neighborhood.  There are many good restaurants within a 5-8 minute walk.  Bed was small but very comfortable.  Renters should be aware that the bathroom is a European style, that is, there is no separate shower stall.  The shower head is in the middle of the bathroom ceiling so the entire bathroom is in effect the shower stall.  Not a problem once you're used to it, but just be aware that is the design.
This is a very special space, with loads of character and charm, in a wonderful West Village location. Plus, a helpful, considerate host and two friendly cats!

Great location, unique lodging, very comfortable bed, bathroom was also unique, but the shower was really good with lots of water pressure.  Ann was very helpful and available to give suggestions but respectful of privacy. Her cats were extremely lovely and didn't run away when I tried to give them love. The only thing that was less than perfect for me was the smell of cigarette smoke that was noticeable every evening. Not sure where it came from and I am sensitive to it so it may not be an issue for other lodgers but for militant non-smokers it could be an issue. Highly recommend for a unique NY experience in one of my favorite parts of NY.

Designed by the owner and filled with a large collection of objects from her world travels, this charming 1830s era townhouse exudes ambience and warmth. If you're looking for an authentic New York living experience complete with Afghan rugs and purring cats, this is the place for you. The guest suite is roomy and has a very comfortable bed.
This great find is nestled in the heart of West Greenwich Village, home to a myriad of cafe's, restaurants and charmingly winding streets.
I can't wait for my next trip to New York City so I can stay there again !
Second time staying at Ann's place and it's still great—charming, cozy and convenient!
I had an amazing stay and Ann was a fantastic host! I highly recommend it.

Ann's place is exactly as pictured in the Italian magazine article that accompanies her listing. The decor is charming and makes for a special experience. The weather was cold during my stay, but the space heater kept the room toasty. However, the bathroom (which maybe doesn't have a heat source? I'm not sure) was cold. Still, it was great to have a private bath, which seems a rarity for an Airbnb in that neighborhood, based on the listings I saw.

There are many thoughtful amenities, including a white noise machine, iron, hairdryer, and electric teakettle in the room, and high quality shampoo, conditioner, and other products in the bathroom.
Ann was a terrific host. I had a great night sleep and really enjoyed her beautiful apartment.

The location is fantastic with two nearby subway stations. Also, very near NYU, just 10 minutes walk. Ann is a fantastic host and she is straight to the point and makes everything clear for the guest. You get to use the whole second floor to yourself and you get perfect privacy. The house is very cozy and really helped me feel like a New Yorker for a week.  Greenwich village is a great place with lots of great restaurants and bars. Would stay here again when traveling alone in NYC.
Great spot in the West Village and perfect for a quick weekend! Thanks Ann
Had a delightful, quiet, easy stay in Ann’s wonderful, book-filled townhome. Close to everything. Comfortable and cozy! Thanks again!
Great location, very responsive and overall good experience.
Ann’s place was in a great location, walkable to many shops and restaurants and was accurate to the listing
Nice and cozy spot. Ann was super communicative, helpful and responsive.  Her cats are adorable too!
Cool place in a great location.
Wonderful space full of life and clean as a whistle! I love the area and always stay close when in the city. Anne was a delightful host and I'd return anytime!
Ann's place is amazing - as is Ann! Wonderful get-away in the heart of West Village.
Good location and cozy room.

Ann was a wonderful host. Her home is like a museum; the room I stayed in was filled with books and original art and textiles from Afghanistan and the Middle East. Lots and lots of fascinating books! Great location. I'll think about staying there again in future trips to New York.

I was visiting NYU and this was the perfect location for my needs and the freedom to come and go as I pleased was just what I needed.  The property is situated in a very convenient part of the city with lots of bars and restaurants.  You can hear the noise from the tavern across the road (on busy nights) but it didn't bother me much as I was pretty shattered each night and fell asleep quickly.

Ann is a lovely host and attentive to your needs but also values her privacy.  The room was lovely and a great place to stay if you love books.  Recommended!
Ann replied to my queries very quickly and ccommodated my early check-in request. Great location!
The host canceled this reservation 17 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
A cozy place in a great location!

Cosy and comfortable stay in a fantastic location. This is the ideal place if you are a foodie as there are some amazing restaurants just a few minutes walk away. The metro connections are great, you can get anywhere pretty quickly! Quite a few sites are within a 30 minute walk.
Ann was very welcoming and hospitable and made sure my stay was comfortable, enjoyable and stress free! She responds to questions very quickly. I would love to stay there again!

This is a well located place (quite noisy though), you have a large room for yourself + your own bathroom. The bathroom is a bit odd because the shower is just in the middle of it, but this is fancy. The real problem is that I had explicitly asked Ann if I could leave my luggage until time for my late plane and she replied yes upon reservation; but it had become no by the time I arrived, without any advance notice. The reason is that Ann had a chance to rent her full appartment to a family, it would earn her a lot of money, and the arrangement we had seemed to not matter anymore. Wake-up on Sunday morning was 8:30 am because the maid had to clean the whole appartment and I was asked to leave my room by 10:00. Much of this would have been acceptable if stated and agreed in advance. But I don't think failing the contract when I am there and have no other option is at all fair.

I suppose the best review one can give is to say next time I am in NYC, I will stay here again if it is available. 
The host communicates effectively. The location is excellent if you are looking for that area of the City. The house is 150+ years old so that adds to its character almost as much as the owner has. 
I’d live there in heartbeat but if you want the Hilton then your tastes and mine differ, that is merely an observation not an editorial. 
The host states up front she does not interfere or necessarily interact with guests but if you need anything including transportation tips etc. she is completely accessible. 
It is very reasonably priced, in fact from my past experiences in the city I consider it a value.
Super endroit, quartier génial, bons restaurants. Cher ! Mais c’est New York
Outstanding gem in west village. Great neighborhood

A charming room in an old house and fantastic location. Ann is a helpful and seasoned host. This was great for a solo traveler. House (shared with host) was quiet and fun to have friendly cats. Because it's off 7th Ave, there was some street noise. Overall much more interesting than the standard hotel!
Had a great stay. Will def come back
This was an excellent place for me to stay. It’s really well presented and comfortable, the host is supportive and it’s a great address.
Ann's place is great, she's a considerate host and the location can't be beat.
Amazing location in West Village and a very nice apartment.

name: Sunny 1bd - Near SOHO Washington SQ
summary: Charming, bright, downtown apt in Greenwich Village, one of NY's most desirable neighborhoods. Near the best transit/shopping/restaurants. Centrally located- SOHO/Washington Sq/West Village all within short walk.  2nd floor walk up.
space: The space is clean, inviting and bright, with a window in every room. This space is small, yet feels open and relaxing. The apartment is second floor, with windows looking onto a tree lined street. Its easy to walk out the door and get anywhere, but also enjoyable to sit and people watch from the window seat.
description: Charming, bright, downtown apt in Greenwich Village, one of NY's most desirable neighborhoods. Near the best transit/shopping/restaurants. Centrally located- SOHO/Washington Sq/West Village all within short walk.  2nd floor walk up. The space is clean, inviting and bright, with a window in every room. This space is small, yet feels open and relaxing. The apartment is second floor, with windows looking onto a tree lined street. Its easy to walk out the door and get anywhere, but also enjoyable to sit and people watch from the window seat. Kitchen, Bathroom, Bedroom, Wifi, TV (Apple TV only= Movies, Netflix, HBO, News), Hanging Closet, Washer & Dryer (downstairs takes quarters Dry Cleaner/ Laundry service also next door), Coffee Maker, Hair Dryer, Fresh towels and linens, Queen Air Mattress provided upon request. Note: this is my personal space so closet space is limited. This is my personal apartment which I only rent on limited basis to cover the high costs of living in NYC. I travel f
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of Greenwich Village, the apartment is great for those looking to experience downtown. The village has amazing charm, with coffee shops and quant streets around every corner. Some of the best shopping and restaurants can be found in SOHO, a few blocks away. Washington Square Park & NYU are a short 2 block walk, and it's a 5 minute stroll to the Hudson River and West Village.
transit: Biking:  There are now CitiBike portals throughout the village, I suggest guests sign up for a pass.  Train:  Ideal for access to both East and West Side. Within 6 blocks east you have access to the 6 train (as well as N,R,B,D,F,M) and going West within 4 blocks you have the 1 Train (as well as A,C, E).  Cabs: There are a ton of cabs on Houston & Bleecker Street.
access: Kitchen, Bathroom, Bedroom, Wifi, TV (Apple TV only= Movies, Netflix, HBO, News), Hanging Closet, Washer & Dryer (downstairs takes quarters Dry Cleaner/ Laundry service also next door), Coffee Maker, Hair Dryer, Fresh towels and linens, Queen Air Mattress provided upon request. Note: this is my personal space so closet space is limited. This is my personal apartment which I only rent on limited basis to cover the high costs of living in NYC. I travel for work often so there is a lot of time I am not in my apartment.
interaction: I make myself available to answer any questions & offer guidance and tips for their visit.
house_rules: Please be respectful of neighbors after 10 pm. Please just tell people in the building you are a friend of mine.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I left my heart in San Francisco.... luckily I didn't leave my job, which is based there and brings me back to the city often.

reviews.comments: We had the pleasure to stay at Molly's great apartment in SoHo. It is a fantastic location, very convenient and close to many great restaurants and shops. The only drawback about being so centrally located, is it's noisy at night, but ear plugs are an easy fix to that. The apartment has everything you need for a comfortable stay.

Neighborhood was great, place was as described. Molly was extremely helpful and responsive! The place was comfortable, and more space than the average NYC apt! (of course not saying much... ;)) Only callout is the place does smell like cigarette smoke, most of my things had a residue aroma from it when I returned. Not a huge deal but something to know if you're highly sensitive.

Molly's place was exactly as described and very convenient. Although I mainly just slept there after working long hours, it was a great location with awesome amenities. The bed was extra comfy. Molly was also very communicative and responsive. I would definitely recommend her place.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Molly was very helpful and communicative.  Great place to stay!
It is a great place to stay!
The apartment is perfect for a stay in city, centrally located, beautiful decor, felt right at home!
Molly has a lovely place in one of best areas of Manhattan. Everything from the communication to the personal touches was excellent. Great choice for everybody who wants to enjoy his stay.

Awesome location.   Walked to Washington Square Park.  World Trade Center, & Brooklyn Bridge.   Quiet street.  Convenient to restaurants, great market, coffee shops, and sights.  Easy walk up apartment on quiet street.   Molly was very helpful with answers to our questions.  Only drawback:  Our stay was too short.   Thanks,  Molly

We had a great time at Molly’s apartment. It is in the best location in New York. 

Molly is a fabulous host and recommend some wonderful places. The apartment itself is very comfortable and very nicely decorated, we felt at home straight away.
The place is great and Molly is an excellent host! Really enjoyed staying at her place.
Fantastic space in a perfect neighbourhood for exploring New York. 100% recommend.
Great place with a great location. Definitely recommend!

This is a fabulous place to stay! The location is amazing with local eats a few steps away, including cool cafes and vegan options. Molly was super-responsive and always answered any questions quickly regarding the neighborhood, etc. She’s a great host. Also, I loved how much light came into the apt.
Very good stay at Molly's house. Feel like in my own home. Apartment is like in the photos. Great location between SoHo and Greenwich. Molly is super responsive !
Great location. Small apartment but very comfortable and all you need for a few days stay in the city

If you want to be downtown, in The Village/Soho, this place is where it's at! Noisy at night, all the sounds of an exciting city scene filled with young people and locals, and a cool haven from the heat when the day gets going.  Close to great restaurants, chic shopping and super for photography and  people-watching.  Convenient supermarkets nearby, and situated an easy 7-minute walk from two different subway lines. Enjoy the real New York, and imagine the city of yesteryear.
The host canceled this reservation 14 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Molly is the kind of host that makes me wish my previous five-star reviews were four-star reviews. She's very attentive and helpful. She met us in person and answered all of our questions even after we checked in.

The space is a genuine NYC-style apartment and comes with all the charm (and for some, maybe surprises) which that entails. The location is great and in a fun part of Manhattan. There is some street noise but it was actually much less than I expected. Most folks staying here will fine with the hum of the A/C and others will be fine simply wearing earplugs. Some may need neither.

Consider booking this place because both the host and the apartment are great, and it provides a genuine NYC-apartment experience in a great part of town.
This is an amazing place in the city. I wished I had more time just to stay in the apartment, but the location is so great you'll find the best local experience in all Manhattan. loved it
Great apt in a lovely location, Molly’s apt clean and well appointed. Don’t forget your ear plugs, it’s NYC!

Molly's apartment is very cosy and in a lively neighbourhood. Molly is nice and answers promptly to all needs. There is not so much storing space at home, so be prepared if you come for a longer stay. Underground is 8-10 minutes walk.  As for the rest, it is ideal for 2 people willing to live NYC.

Molly is a great host! 
Very helpful in every way. Highly recommended apartment.

Molly's place in the West Village was a great launching pad into the best neighborhood in Manhattan!  The location can't be beat, with easy access to dozens of bars and restaurants and two subway stops in easy walking distance.  the apartment itself is bigger than it looked in the photos and was very comfortable for the price.  Molly was a great host and we especially appreciated her flexible check-in and check-out!  Our only complaint is that the radiator pipes for the floors above pass right by the head of the bed, and the banging at 6am every morning is incredibly loud; being light sleepers there was no way to avoid being woken up by it.  Had we known this we probably would not have chosen to stay here, but it would probably be fine for very sound sleepers.
Location was the best!!!! Molly was so helpful, considerate and nice. I loved this place so much

name: Experience Local Living in Well-Connected Beach Retreat
summary: Start each day on the beach across the road before returning to this light-filled apartment. Funky wall coverings and bright pillows adorn the master bedroom, while the living area has a textured stone dining table and colorful avian pictures.
space: Fresh, clear and sunny apartment, newly equipped.  Each room has a separate AC unit. Two balconies, one oriented to the sunrise and other to the sunset. Room 1 has a double bed(140x200) Room 2 has a single bed(80x200) that can be turned into a double(160x200) All rooms have an exterior view, panoramic floor plan.
description: Start each day on the beach across the road before returning to this light-filled apartment. Funky wall coverings and bright pillows adorn the master bedroom, while the living area has a textured stone dining table and colorful avian pictures.
neighborhood_overview: Poblenou is a gem in Barcelona, with a laidback beach atmosphere and the feel of a traditional Spanish village. It has some great local bars, cafes, and eateries, but is also well-connected to the city center by metro or bus.
notes: The cost of the monthly rental covers up to €100 of electricity consumption, which is usually enough, the guest will cover any cost above this.
transit: The area has everything you need, just a stone throw from Rambla del Poblenou, a boulevard full of restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Supermarkets are very close by, as bakeries and the Mercat del Poblenou(traditional market) is a definite highlight for groceries, meats and fish shopping. Bus H16 stops right in front and takes you to Plaza Catalunya in 15 minutes.  Closest metro stop is Poblenou, yellow line, 6-8’ walk.
interaction: We are always available to our guests, going above and beyond to make the best out of their stay.  Please call or text, through Airbnb, sms or (Hidden by Airbnb) .

host.host_about: Make your life a better place

reviews.comments: Для нас это лучшее место в Барселоне! Квартира расположена идеально, совсем рядом с морем. В тоже время автобус возле подъезда довезет в центр (пл. Каталунии, пл. Испании). Район очень спокойный, до метро 10 минут пешком по Рамбле Побленоу, где много кафе, магазинов, аптеки, банки...Хозяйка Регина очень доброжелательная, хорошая. В квартире есть посудомойка, духовка, микроволновка, стиральная машина. Мы жили месяц , остались очень довольны! Рекомендуем (Website hidden by Airbnb) For us, this is the best place in Barcelona! The apartment is located perfectly, very close to the sea. At the same time, the bus near the entrance will take you to the center ( Plaza Catalunia, Plaza Espania). The area is very calm, to the metro 10 minutes walk along the Rambla Poblenou, where there are many cafes, shops, pharmacies, banks ...Regina is very friendly, she is the best. The apartment has a dishwasher, oven, microwave, washing machine, nice wifi. We lived a month, were very satisfied! Recommended!

Me and my boyfriend were for 7 weeks in barcelona and we lived in this beautiful flat, near the beach and Rambla de Poblenou.
The surroundings is the best, you have everything in the near what you need.
We are very happy and want to come back next year.
Thank you!!!

el Piso se encuentra en una excelente ubicación, cerca de la playa pero también cerca de la movida en la Rambla de Poblenou. Bien comunicado, cerca de dos estaciones de Metro y varias lineas de BUS que pasan por la puerta.
Es perfecto para 4 personas, pero teniendo Sofa Cama, acepta recibir algunas visitas. Hemos estado 1 mes alli y hubiéramos deseado quedarnos por mas tiempo.
La respuesta de Nu fue siempre al instante cuando lo hemos requerido.
Perfecto para unas vacaciones o para largas estadias.

The flat is very nice, near the beach and the rambla Poblenu.  There is almost everithing for live in the house for cook, the flat is clean and very bright. We hope in future to use again Nu flat. Thanks

This is the best AirBnB I have ever stayed in! It looked recently renovated, it was very spacious, good size living area and it had two balconies. The kitchen was very well equipped with a lot of attention to detail, even kitchen foil and freezer bags were provided. The beach is less than 5 minutes away and it is the cleanest city beach that I have even seen. The best part about the place is its location. It is literary in the centre of Poblenou, and within seconds you have a lovely pedestrian area with lots of restaurants and bars. The whole area has a great buzz about it! If you like both having the beach nearby and a wide range of eating options, this is the perfect place. It is much better than staying in the centre of the city as you get to experience Barcelona as a local. Plus, the flat is about 20-30 minutes walk to the centre of the city. It is very well connected with a number of buses and a metro line that will take you to every central location within 10-30 minutes. Nu was a great host, very responsive and we checked in without any problems. Thank you so much!
This is one of my favorite places I've ever stayed! I wish I could have moved here. :)

Don't be put off by the external appearance of the building. The apartment was great, quirky, but just perfect and a home from home for me for five weeks while visiting from the UK and working locally. Super close to the beach and all the amenities of Poblenou. A very responsive and helpful host. Highly recommended.

reviews.comments: 第一次使用airbnb,这个平台确实不错｡很方便｡租到很不错的房间｡交通交通十分方便｡地处热闹街区里面的安静｡市中心,繁华热闹,5分钟到达繁华的大型豪华商场,超市,购物生活方便｡5分钟可以到达中央火车站｡十分钟左右可以散步情人港广场,10分钟左右,可以步行去享受唐人街中餐美味｡西餐当然遍地都是,15分钟以内可以漫步海德公园｡30分钟步行,可以到达悉尼歌剧院｡屋子干净整洁,设施齐全,你也可以自己做饭,因为厨房设施齐全｡房东沟通方便,中文,粤语,英文都可以与之交流｡耐心热情,服务周到｡又问必答,还可以给出不错的建议｡总之,家庭旅游,商务出差,短中期的居住,都是不错的选择｡很好的平台,很好的房东,值得选择｡以后还会有机会来的

Highly recommend staying here
Modern, clean & comfortable

Yuan is really great, very nice and helpful. The apartment is perfect- has everything we needed, new apartment in a new building, great location only few minutes walk from everything! Highly recommanded!!!
Very good location and good security apartments. Nice room and very happy. Easy to access to CBD.
Great location, near the central station. Large space and easy to get access to everything you need.
非常干净整洁 很好
Linda was very helpful. The location of the apartment was great. The apartment was fairly clean.
Good location, ideal for who needs one or two nights.

Great location with pretty well all the amenities provided. It has been several years since I'd last spent time in Chippendale, and what's been done with the old brewery site is fantastic. Some really good restaurants to explore!
We had a very pleasant stay at Linda’s place! She was very reactive and helpful. Clean, functional and located in the CBD the apartment is perfect for a weekend in Sydney.
Spacious, quiet and good location.  Great view.  New apartment facility.  Hosts were very responsive and accommodating. Enjoyed the stay!

The host deserve every word of the great reviews. Communication was practically instantaneous. They provide a warm welcome, a beautifully clean, comfortable home, everything could possibly need for a short stay, in a great location. Really enjoy, looking forward to stay next time! I cannot recommend them more highly!
Nice and central. Amongst the student accommodation.
A nice place with a nice distance and great view.
Excellent location
Great location, a quiet and private unit with very good air conditioning
Great location, amazing value. Linda was very accomodating and a great host. Would use again  for def.

Linda's communication was very fast, booking and check in was simple. Linda arranged to meet us at a set time near the apartment. Apartment is in a new building, however for our visit it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned. Photos on listing didn't seem to match exactly with actual apartment. Good location near Surry Hills and Ultimo.
Convient location, easy check in and communication.

The value for this place was outstanding. 
There was no couch & no TV. However, the location, the apartment, amenities in the apartment & Linda ( lovely hostess ) were outstanding. 
The place was very clean, bed was very comfortable. 

Lots of windows that could be opened. The place has air conditioner, however I prefer fresh air & there was plenty of it. It was hot in Sydney but I never once had the aircon on. 

Views were lovely. Woolworth just down the road, very close & lots of great places to eat. The area & apartments around look amazing I wish ADELAIDE would take note!!

No more than 10 mins from Central Station. Apart from no couch & tv which didn't bother me that much as this place had so much to offer. The value was exceptional ! 

Definitely would stay again when visiting & definitely would recommend 

THANK YOU Linda :))
Good location, good value of money!

Linda made sure everything was as comfortable as possible. This is a simple and straightforward space for anyone who wants the basics in a good location and close to transport options and plenty of excellent restaurants.
Linda was a great host, the location was ideal and close walk to everything you could ask for
Great value and location.
物超所值

Linda’s place is very central and well connected to public transport and close to good cafes and restaurants. Our only issue was with the toilet cleanliness, which Linda promptly took care off. Apart from that everything else was good.

This house accommodates up to 8 persons in 3 double-rooms, having one of them an extra queen size sofa bed. Bed linens and towels included.
